Body: They are both word building techniques(same super-concept), but i think (I am not a linguistic) they are different sub-concepts. Inflectional suffixes don't change the basic meaning of the word and never change the category of the word (verb, adverb,noun...). They provides inf. about time, quantity, number and comparison. Agglutination or concatenation does change the category of the word: music(nouns)=> musical(adj.)
